thread.title: Taking off: what’s new in the world
thread.title_full: Taking off: what’s new in the world | The Sunday Times

author: Sunday Times
title: Taking off: what’s new in the world
text:
Fly direct to the Spanish east coast (Calle Montes/Getty) Costa where?
Remember Castellon-Costa Azahar airport? Allow us to refresh your memory. It was the £110m white elephant built by the Spanish politician Carlos Fabra, who was subsequently jailed for tax fraud. The airport has been gathering dust for four years, but last week the first flights – Ryanair, natch – touched down, opening up a sunny stretch of the Spanish east coast from Peñiscola, in the north, to Almenara, in the south. Services depart from Stansted and Bristol.
From £40 return; ryanair.com
Villa Rooney
Wayne Rooney is renting his house out. Well, one of them. It’s on the Royal Westmorland golf resort, in Barbados, it has five kingsize bedrooms, a media room and an infinity pool overlooking the Caribbean Sea — and it’s yours for £8,134 for a week in November, a saving of £2,000. We don’t know if Coleen chose the wallpaper.
royalwestmoreland.com
No more Noma
Want to dine on moss,
